prompt:

For EACH market:
1. Estimate the TRUE PROBABILITY based on news context
2. Calculate EDGE vs market price
3. Only recommend trades with 10%+ edge


Market 1:
Title: Will Russia capture all of Myrnohrad by January 31?
Current Market Price: 70.3% (this is the market's implied probability)
Recent trade: $1,800.00 on Yes
Link: https://polymarket.com/event/will-russia-capture-all-of-myrnohrad-by

📰 WEB SEARCH CONTEXT:
As of December 13, 2025, Russian forces have intensified their operations targeting Myrnohrad, a town in Donetsk Oblast, Ukraine. On December 9, Russian General Valery Gerasimov reported that Russian troops are advancing along the entire front line in Ukraine, specifically focusing on Myrnohrad. He claimed that Russian forces have taken control of over 30% of the town's buildings and have encircled Ukrainian troops there. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/world/russias-top-general-says-army-is-advancing-ukraine-targeting-myrnohrad-2025-12-09/?utm_source=openai))

In response, Ukrainian forces are employing active defense tactics to repel Russian assaults. Commander-in-Chief Oleksandr Syrskyi stated on December 13 that Russian forces have deployed additional reserves near Pokrovsk and Myrnohrad, increasing pressure on Ukrainian troops. Despite this, Ukrainian units continue to improve their positions and dislodge Russian forces in some areas. ([kyivindependent.com](https://kyivinde

---

This means he will miss Liverpool's upcoming matches, including the one against Tottenham. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/sports/soccer/salah-will-leave-behind-liverpool-tension-play-egypt-africa-cup-2025-12-12/?utm_source=openai))

- **Managerial Tensions:** Salah's recent public criticism of Liverpool's management has led to tensions with manager Arne Slot. A meeting is scheduled to address these issues, which may influence team dynamics ahead of the Tottenham match. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/spor

---


Provide predictions in the exact format specified.
system_prompt:
You are a prediction market expert analyzing Polymarket markets.
You have been provided with RECENT NEWS AND CONTEXT for each market from web search.

IMPORTANT: For each market, you MUST estimate the TRUE PROBABILITY of the outcome.
Compare your probability estimate to the market price to find EDGE (mispricing).

Edge = Your Probability - Market Probability
- Positive edge on YES side means market undervalues YES
- Negative edge means market overvalues YES (bet NO instead)

For each market, provide your prediction in this EXACT format:

MARKET [number]: [decision]
Your Probability: [0-100]%
Market Price: [shown price]%
Edge: [+/-X]% (Your prob - Market)
Expected Value: [calculate: Edge × potential payout]
Reasoning: [1-2 sentences explaining your probability estimate]

Decision must be one of: YES, NO, or NO_TRADE
- YES = Your probability > Market price + 10% (minimum 10% edge)
- NO = Your probability < Market price - 10%
- NO_TRADE = Edge < 10% (not enough value)

Be contrarian when you have conviction. Look for markets where news hasn't been priced in yet.
consensus_summary: The consensus shows strong disagreement on Market 1, with probabilities ranging from 40% to 75%, though two analysts recommend betting against the market's high "Yes" price. For Markets 2 and 3, opinions are split, with no clear trade recommendation emerging as all calculated edges fall below the 10% threshold or analysts contradict each other. Overall, there is no unified, actionable trade signal across the three markets based on the provided analyses.

MARKET 2: NO

MARKET 3: NO  
Your Probability: 45%  
Market Price: 53.0%
